channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken manhole cover, 29th January
item.description:
BT manhole cover which has sunken over time by about 3ins on one side which is causing a hazard

item.title: Speed sign not working, 29th January
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping at usual hot spot side of Candy Box Maple Crescent, 29th January
item.description:
Yet again a soiled mattress and plastic sack containing bed pillows have been dumped at the usual location. This is a continual problem which needs tackling by CCTV monitoring covertly. Please can this rubbish be removed promptly Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mountain of bed bug furniture from neighbour is blocking my walkway, 29th January
item.description:
More has been added everyday. Hazmat suits have been multiple times to the flat, yet still no collection from the council? The entire contents of the flat is scattered around the street. The bed bugs could already have infested other houses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Grove, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo on pathway, 29th January
item.description:
This has been going on for months and nothing seems to be sorted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Caerleon Close, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 29th January
item.description:
Outside 64 Norwood rd/corner of deronda Rd. Issue reported yesterday and is worse today. This block of flats only has one recycling bin which is used for all rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deronda Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Collapsed brick wall, debris all over the pavement, 29th January
item.description:
A brick wall is collapsed and there is debris all over the pavement/pedestrian island. This needs to be cleared and the existing brick wall made safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Westminster Bridge Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Debris including football on reservation, 29th January
item.description:
There keeps piling up with debris on the reservation ie strip of pavement between lanes on A406 North Circular - the red football appeared this week. I have never seen it clear of debris since driving here daily for three years. Please clean it up many thanks Mrs Lewis

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, Temple Fortune, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signage on lamppost and litter, 29th January
item.description:
There is an old paper poster littered by the telephone box in The Broadway at the junction of Avenue Road. This litter has been there a week and nobody has picked it up! There is a pavilion sign stuck on a post advertising their services next to the telephone box near this litter. Please can you remove and keep our area tidy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy Manhole Cover, 29th January
item.description:
Hi - I have reported this before. There is a manhole outside my property, when cars go over this it clanks and means we cannot sleep. Please can this be addressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelyn Street, New Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, overflowing bins, used nappies, 29th January
item.description:
Every week outside the same row of terraced houses on the left hand side going up the hill are piles of rubbish, over-flowing bins, food and used nappies left to rot and cover the pavement. it is an eye sore, a health hazard and totally unfair to the local residents in the area. Once you have passed this bio-hazard you then have to avoid the extremely over grown hedge till you get to the corner, and then avoid the perpetual thames water roadworks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ripon Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped boxes on Royston road, near garage, 29th January
item.description:
Cardboard Boxes have been fly tipped on our pavement that are not from the streets residents. Currently the boxes have been there for over 24 hours.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royston Road, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
